reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every 90 days, with specific dates for midterm and final reports: 9 November 2013 (midterm), 9 May 2014 (final), and 9 June 2014 (submission to Council)
summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on Iran, including 1696 (2006), 1737 (2006), 1747 (2007), 1803 (2008), 1835 (2008), 1887 (2009), 1929 (2010), 1984 (2011), and 2049 (2012),

1. Extends the mandate of the Panel of Experts, as specified in paragraph 29 of resolution 1929 (2010), until 9 July 2014, and intends to review the mandate and take action regarding further extension no later than 9 June 2014.

2. Requests the Panel to provide a midterm report to the Committee by 9 November 2013, and to the Council by 9 December 2013, and a final report to the Committee by 9 May 2014, and to the Council by 9 June 2014.

3. Requests the Panel to provide a planned programme of work to the Committee within thirty days, and to provide updates to the programme of work.

4. Expresses its intent to follow the work of the Panel.

5. Urges all States, UN bodies, and interested parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and the Panel, particularly by providing information on the implementation of measures imposed by relevant resolutions.

6. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
